newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks rise in early morning trade.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks rise in early morning trade.

text.p: Tokyo stocks rose in early morning trade on Thursday, inspired by U.S. markets which closed sharply higher overnight on post-election jubilation, brokers said. They said buy-backs and futures-linked trades were leading cash stocks higher.
At 0016 GMT, the key Nikkei 225 was 113.29 points or 0.54 percent higher at 21,104.81. Its December futures were 50 points higher at 21,150.
"The Nikkei average will try to consolidate around the 21,000 level today if it can, supported by buy-backs by dealers and arbitrage activity," a dealer at "big four" brokerage said.
